page.title: 12FAMOUS PEOPLE _ 1
page.content:
{MARY ANN COTTON.
The children of West Auckland sing this skipping rhyme :
Mary Ann Cotton,she's dead and she's rotten, She lies in her grave with her mouth wide oppen. Sing,sing,what shall we sing ? Mary Ann Cotton's hung on a string.
The subject of the rhyme lived on the village green and was alleged to have killed 22 relatives including her own children and husbands to obtain insur- ance money.She was hanged and buried in Durham Jail in 1873.
{For a world famous team, turn to page {13. }
